snippet: Dozens of officials, including ward councilors, party leaders and mayors, have been killed in what has become a desperate, deadly struggle for power and its spoils.
abstract: Dozens of South African officials, including ward councilors, party leaders and mayors, have been killed in what has become a desperate, deadly struggle for power and its spoils; nearly 40 politicians have been killed since 2010, amid waning economic opportunities, rising corruption and widespread anger at the powerful African National Congress party.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of officials, including ward councilors, party leaders and mayors, have been killed in what has become a desperate, deadly struggle for power and its spoils.

headline.seo: South Africa Corruption Fuels Battle for Political Spoils
headline.main: In South Africa, Lethal Battles for Even Smallest of Political Posts
headline.print_headline: In South Africa, Lethal Battles for Even Smallest of Political Posts
